page.title: 12TRAFFIC ON THE A19
page.content: On June 17th 1985 from 11.40-11.55 a.m.we surveyed the traffic on the A19.road in our area.The Northbound side of the road had 132 cars,5 cars with caravans,17 vans,10 pickup trucks ,40 container trucks,32 lorries,3 buses,1 car transporter,1 fire engine, 3 skips,1 taxi and 1 farm vehicle.The Southbound carriageway is also a very busy route.It had 136 cars,35 vans,4 pickup trucks,40 container trucks,7 petrol tankers,20 lorries,2 buses,2 car transporters,1 fire engine,1 cement mixer and 4 farm vehicles.Much of this is long distance traffic because the A19 is one of the major routes through County Durham.However there is a lot of local traffic using the A19 to reach nearby towns.
